title.narrative: F.a: Primary Dental Care Support Programme

description.narrative: Primary Dental Care Support Programme. The cooperation seeks to promote dental health among young generations in Pyongyang area by increasing the awareness of the causes to dental diseases and their preventive acts, supporting the daily home care possibili ties among the target population and by providing the cooperation hospitals with some material aid. Fida?s partner is The Korea Education Fund (KEF), a non-governmental organization to support education approved by the government of the DPRK. The initiatio n to the work came from the local authorities and it was launched autumn 2007 in Pyongyang?s two districts. Because the work was expanding successfully, the Primary Dental Care Support Programme was established in the beginning of 2009. The awareness of th e programme has spread also to the other districts leading to several enquiries to the partner how to get along. The preventive work is based on the World Health Organization?s (WHO) Oral Health Promotion Programme where the education comes close to the t arget population when given by community trainers while the professionals serve as mentors and supervisors. Tooth brushes, pastes and educational material are distributed to the target group children in order to strengthen the education. The cooperation ho spitals are provided with the mostly required equipment needed to treatment procedures. The project goal is to strengthen the basic knowledge of dental diseases and their prevention among the whole DPRK population. After the initiative phase, the work is g oing to be shifted to the locals. Fida?s representatives had a privilege to participate in a presentation seminar arranged by the partner in October 2008.
